title: Introduction to Machine Learning
description: Learn the fundamentals of machine learning, including supervised and unsupervised learning, and common algorithms.

sections.title: What is Machine Learning?
sections.content: Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that enables computers to learn and make decisions from data without being explicitly programmed for every task.

sections.title: Types of Machine Learning
sections.content: There are three main types: supervised learning (learning with labeled data), unsupervised learning (finding patterns in unlabeled data), and reinforcement learning (learning through interaction with an environment).

sections.title: Common Algorithms
sections.content: Popular algorithms include linear regression, decision trees, neural networks, and clustering algorithms like k-means.

title: Linear Regression Fundamentals
description: Dive deep into linear regression, one of the most fundamental algorithms in machine learning.

sections.title: Understanding Linear Regression
sections.content: Linear regression is a statistical method that models the relationship between a dependent variable and one or more independent variables using a linear equation.

sections.title: The Math Behind It
sections.content: The equation y = mx + b represents a simple linear regression, where m is the slope and b is the y-intercept. In multiple regression, we have y = b0 + b1x1 + b2x2 + ... + bnxn.

sections.title: Cost Function and Gradient Descent
sections.content: We use the Mean Squared Error (MSE) as our cost function and gradient descent to minimize it and find the best parameters.

title: Data Preprocessing Techniques
description: Master the art of preparing your data for machine learning models with various preprocessing techniques.

sections.title: Data Cleaning
sections.content: Remove missing values, handle outliers, and ensure data quality before feeding it to your models.

sections.title: Feature Scaling
sections.content: Normalize and standardize your features to ensure all variables contribute equally to the model.

sections.title: Feature Engineering
sections.content: Create new features from existing ones to improve model performance and capture more complex patterns.

title: Classification Algorithms
description: Explore various classification algorithms including logistic regression, decision trees, and random forests.

sections.title: Logistic Regression
sections.content: A classification algorithm that uses the logistic function to model the probability of categorical outcomes.

sections.title: Decision Trees
sections.content: Tree-like models that make decisions by asking a series of questions about the input features.

sections.title: Random Forest
sections.content: An ensemble method that combines multiple decision trees to improve accuracy and reduce overfitting.

title: Neural Networks and Deep Learning
description: Introduction to neural networks, backpropagation, and the basics of deep learning.

sections.title: Perceptron and Neural Networks
sections.content: Learn about the basic building blocks of neural networks, including perceptrons and how they combine to form complex networks.

sections.title: Backpropagation
sections.content: Understand how neural networks learn by adjusting weights through backpropagation of errors.

sections.title: Deep Learning Applications
sections.content: Explore how deep neural networks are used in computer vision, natural language processing, and other domains.

title: Model Evaluation and Validation
description: Learn how to properly evaluate your machine learning models and avoid common pitfalls.

sections.title: Train-Test Split
sections.content: Split your data into training and testing sets to evaluate model performance on unseen data.

sections.title: Cross-Validation
sections.content: Use k-fold cross-validation to get a more robust estimate of model performance.

sections.title: Metrics and Evaluation
sections.content: Understand different evaluation metrics like accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score for classification problems.
